item.title: Google’s 3D video conferencing platform, Project Starline, is coming in 2025 with help from HP
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
In 2021, Google kicked off work on Project Starline, a corporate-focused teleconferencing platform that uses 3D imaging, cameras and a custom-designed screen to let people converse with someone as if they were in the same room — more or less. Now, after years of testing and private technical previews (and development setbacks from a division […]

item.title: Instagram expands its creator marketplace to 10 new countries
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Over the weekend, Instagram announced that it is expanding its creator marketplace to 10 new countries — this marketplace connects brands with creators to foster collaboration. The new regions include South Korea, Germany, Netherlands, France, Spain, Israel, Turkey, Mexico, Argentina and Indonesia. Meta first introduced this marketplace to facilitate paid partnerships in the U.S. to […]

item.description:

item.title: Booking.com latest to fall under EU market power rules
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:

item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:

item.title: Women in AI: Rep. Dar’shun Kendrick wants to pass more AI legislation
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
To give AI-focused women academics and others their well-deserved — and overdue — time in the spotlight, TechCrunch has been publishing a series of interviews focused on remarkable women who’ve contributed to the AI revolution. We’re publishing these pieces throughout the year as the AI boom continues, highlighting key work that often goes unrecognized. Read more profiles here. […]

item.description:

item.title: U.K. agency releases tools to test AI model safety
